subject: Management
title: Ignoring the Middle
description: A fast breakdown of Ignoring the Middle for builders.

hook.text: A CEO convinced the board and briefed the front line. Middle managers were never consulted. The plan collapsed.

buildup.text: Change initiatives often focus on top leadership and front-line workers. The middle gets ignored.

discovery.text: Middle managers are the translation layer. They convert strategy into daily action. Skip them and nothing moves.

twist.text: Middle managers who feel excluded become passive resisters. They don't block openlyâ€”they just don't push.

climax.text: Involve middle managers early. Give them ownership. They're your change multipliers, not your obstacles.

punchline.text: Win the middle and the change has legs. Lose them and it stalls.

quiz.question: Why are middle managers critical to change success?
options: They translate strategy into daily action and multiply change across the organization
They are the easiest group to convince about any change
Middle managers have no real influence on change outcomes
